posts.cooked: Would it be possible to get an Android Wear app? You can reply to a notification from the Android Wear notifications, but those notifications dismiss after you reply and there’s no way to pull up a conversation or initiate a message from your smartwatch. It would also be nice to be able to take secure voice calls from your smartwatch too, like how Google allows you to accept normal insecure calls from it. The Android Wear app could also support SMS like the full Android app does.

posts.name: Alexander Bantyev
posts.cooked: Also, it would be very nice to have a standalone application (like Telegram one) so that one could use it without having the phone around. Although I suppose smartwatches with SIM cards or WiFi modules are still rare.

posts.name: Jandechent
posts.cooked: Seems there are only few wear users out there I would love to be able to leave my phone at home and have my wear with me. And signal

posts.name: Adam Parish
posts.cooked:
I personally, don’t see the benefit of a Wear app right now. I get my Signal notifications on my Android Wear watch just fine. I don’t see the benefit of a Wear OS Singal app since the notifications work so well as-is.

Yes. I actually have a Wear OS watch (see picture)

IMG_20190121_164425 (1).jpg4032×3024 3.45 MB

Wasn’t a fan of wearables until I got a Fossil Gen 5 with Wear OS 2. The app on it for Telegram is very nice and I am missing that for Signal. Looking forward to a Wear app for Signal which will win over more users this way, as WhatsApp is at the moment also without a wearable app.

until I got a Fossil Gen 5 with Wear OS 2. The app on it for Telegram is very nice
@Pander

Is it true that the app works even if your phone is powered right down? (over wifi for example)
Yes, that is true, over wifi e.g.

posts.name: Arkadiusz
posts.cooked:
Any update on that?
I really wish there are some standalone application for Signal, just like on Telegram app.
Functionality to cover:

  • read full history of conversation (instead of last message)
  • Record/hear voice messages

posts.name: Bartłomiej Smolnik
posts.cooked: I got my first watch with wear os and I really miss functionality of signal, like make calls, and writing messages, it’s already great, that I can reply, but it’s still not enough.

posts.name: Jyri Autio
posts.cooked: I also would love to use Signal with my Wear OS. I use Signal for my messages and leave phone home many times when I go out. SMS and calls I can do with my watch, but Signal-messages is what I need the most.

posts.name: Jeremy
posts.cooked: Especially with the new Samsung watches breathing more life into WearOS

posts.name: Nat SMITH
posts.cooked: I just got a Galaxy Watch 4, and I’m thinking about moving to Telegram since they have a Wear OS app.

posts.name: Jeremy
posts.cooked: Use both apps… telegram for convenience and signal for security

posts.name: Nat SMITH
posts.cooked:
I really want to.
But to be honest, it’s already really hard to ask people to quit Whatsapp, and they won’t use 2 apps.

In my work environment, We use Signal, but the lack of tablet support and the poor desktop app are becoming a problem.

I support Signal since the beginning, but I can’t keep promessing features We don’t have any news for a few years.

That all want to switch to Telegram, and the Wear OS app is just another thing We’ll never have on Signal because developers’ priorities are just not in touch with the users.

That’s really makes me sad, but I don’t think they care about losing users. This is not a company.

posts.name: Jeremy
posts.cooked: Switching to telegram basically throws security out the window with groups.

posts.name: Nat SMITH
posts.cooked: Yep, but people prefer being able to work or communicate than security.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: What issues are you guys having exactly?

posts.name: Nat SMITH
posts.cooked:
No real issue here, We just don’t know if Signal devs work on multi devices features and Wear OS app.

And TBH I don’t think so.

They focus on updates that aims the youngest, but teenagers just do not care about Signal.

They need to be able to keep their core users.

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
Nat_SMITH:

to Telegram since they have a Wear OS app.

Telegram abandons its Wear OS app as the platform loses another major player

It's the second app this week to leave wearables behind
